item.title: Divergence
item.description: What is Divergence? Divergence is when the price of an asset is moving in the opposite direction of a technical indicator, such as an oscillator, or is moving contrary to other data. Divergence warns that the current price trend may be weakening, and in some cases may lead to the price changing direction. There is positive and negative divergence. Positive divergence indicates a move higher in the price of the asset is possible.

item.title: Reversal Strategy
item.description: A Technical Analysis Reversal Strategy which utilizes price action
